column1: Ten-year-old Chihiro Ogino and her parents are traveling to their new home when her father decides to take a shortcut. The family's car stops in front of a tunnel leading to what appears to be an abandoned amusement park which Chihiro's father insists on exploring
column2: despite his daughter's protest. They find a seemingly empty restaurant still stocked with food
column3: which Chihiro's parents immediately begin to eat. While exploring further
column4: Chihiro finds an exquisite bathhouse and meets a boy named Haku
column5: who warns her to return across the riverbed before sunset. However
column6: Chihiro discovers too late that her parents have metamorphosed into pigs
column7: and she is unable to cross the now-flooded river. Haku finds Chihiro and has her ask for a job from the bathhouse's boiler-man
column9: a yōkai commanding the susuwatari. Kamaji refuses to hire her and asks worker Lin to send Chihiro to Yubaba
column10: the witch who runs the bathhouse. Yubaba tries to frighten Chihiro away
column12: so Yubaba gives Chihiro a contract to work for her. Yubaba takes away the second kanji of her name
column17: Thousand. While visiting her parents' pigpen
column18: Haku gives Sen a goodbye card she had with her
column19: and Sen realizes that she had already forgotten her real name. Haku warns her that Yubaba controls people by taking their names
column20: and that if she forgets hers like he has forgotten his
column21: she will not be able to leave the spirit world. Sen faces discrimination from the other workers because she is still a human and not a spirit; only Haku and Lin show sympathy for her. While working
column22: she invites a silent creature named No-Face inside
column23: believing him to be a customer. A """stink" "spirit""" arrives as Sen's first customer
column24: and she discovers he is the spirit of a polluted river. In gratitude for cleaning him
column25: he gives Sen a magic emetic dumpling. Meanwhile
column26: No-Face imitates the gold left behind by the stink spirit and tempts a worker with gold
column27: then swallows him. He demands food and begins tipping extensively. He swallows two more workers when they interfere with his conversation with Sen. Sen sees paper Shikigami attacking a Japanese dragon and recognizes the dragon as Haku metamorphosed. When a grievously injured Haku crashes into Yubaba's penthouse
column28: Sen follows him upstairs. A shikigami that stowed away on her back shapeshifts into Zeniba
column29: Yubaba's twin sister. She mutates Yubaba's son
column33: and mutates Yubaba's harpy into a tiny
column34: flylike bird. Zeniba tells Sen that Haku has stolen a magic golden seal from her
column35: and warns Sen that it carries a deadly curse. Haku attacks the shikigami
column36: which eliminates Zeniba's hologram. He falls into the boiler room with Sen
column38: and the harpy on his back
column39: where Sen feeds him part of the dumpling she had intended to give her parents
column40: causing him to vomit both the seal and a black slug
column41: which Sen crushes with her foot. With Haku unconscious
column42: Sen resolves to return the seal and apologize to Zeniba. Sen confronts No-Face
column44: and feeds him the rest of the dumpling. No-Face follows Sen out of the bathhouse
column45: steadily regurgitating everything he has eaten. Sen
column48: and the harpy travel to see Zeniba with train tickets given to her by Kamaji. Yubaba orders that Sen's parents be slaughtered
column49: but Haku reveals that Boh is missing and offers to retrieve him if Yubaba releases Sen and her parents. Yubaba agrees
column50: but only if Sen can pass a final test. Sen
column53: and the harpy meet with Zeniba
column54: who reveals that Sen's love for Haku broke her curse and that Yubaba used the black slug to take control over Haku. Haku appears at Zeniba's home in his dragon form and flies Sen
column56: and the harpy to the bathhouse. No-Face decides to stay behind and become Zeniba's spinner. In mid-flight
column57: Sen recalls falling years ago into the Kohaku River and being washed safely ashore
column58: correctly guessing Haku's real identity as the spirit of the Kohaku River (ニギハヤミ コハクヌシ (饒速水琥珀主/饒速水小白主)
column60: lit. """master" of the swift-flowing amber "[river]""" or """master" of the swift-flowing little white "[river]"")." When they arrive at the bathhouse
column61: Yubaba forces Sen to identify her parents from among a group of pigs in order to break their curse. After Sen answers correctly that none of the pigs are her parents
column62: her contract disappears and she is given back her real name. Haku takes her to the now-dry riverbed and vows to meet her again. Chihiro crosses the riverbed to her restored parents
column63: who do not remember anything after eating at the restaurant stall. They walk back through the tunnel until they reach their car
column64: now covered in dust and leaves. Before getting in
column65: Chihiro is shown to still be wearing the hairband No-Face
column67: and the harpy spun for her at Zeniba's home.
